bibl.title: Memorandum from Albert E. Truby to Colonel Meehan, July 26, 1935

div1.p: Truby's memorandum and attached documents concern the marble bust of Walter Reed that was removed from the Smithsonian Institution and placed at the Walter Reed Army Hospital.

div1.head: Memorandum from Albert E. Truby to Colonel Meehan, July 26, 1935
div1.opener:
Form 17, AMC
File No.___________________________ NOT TO BE REMOVED FROM THIS PAPER
ARMY MEDICAL CENTER
Washington, D. C.
Use this slip for all notes in connection with this paper. All notes
will be NUMBERED CONSECUTIVELY at the left hand side of the slip. DATED
and INITIALED. Papers transmitted should have attached all records neces-
sary for intelligent action. A line will be drawn the full width of the
slip below each note, USE THIS FORM FOR ALL INFORMAL MEMORANDA.
No. 1.
Date July 26, 1935.
MEMORANDUM TO: Colonel Meehan:
div1.p:
1. The attached papers enc. 1; enc. 2; enc. 3 regarding the marble bust of Walter Reed, which
has been placed in the lobby of the Walter Reed Hospital, is all the informa-
tion we have of record.

2. This bust was loaned to the National Museum by the Walter Reed
Memorial Association. I felt that it should be placed here at the Walter
Reed Hospital and got the consent of the Association to let us have it.
I have requested General Kean, the President of the Association, to take
this matter up at their next meeting and to send us a communication stating
whether or not this bust was to be considered as a loan or as a gift, in
order that our records here may be complete.
div1.closer:
/s/ A. E. T.
ALBERT E. TRUBY,
Brigadier General, Medical Department,
Commanding. See letter of Nov 26 attached
AET
ARMY MEDICAL CENTER WASHINGTON, D.C.
----
OFFICIAL
----
FROM GEN. ALBERT E. TRUBY
